intro: Knowltonia vesicatoria subsp. vesicatoria, commonly known as the Florida morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped, velvety leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a native species with unique floral morphology and ecological adaptations.
